comments:
Build ID:  I20061214-1445
I am using Eclipse 3.3 on OS X (10.4.8), running on Java 6

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Select a resource
2.Compare it with History
3.Ensure the History view has the Remote Revisions option on

(It doesn't matter whether you use the default port or specify one in the CVS location preferences.)


You will get the following stack:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.Error: Illegal character in port number at index 61: cvs://:extssh:channingwalton@moreunit.cvs.sourceforge.net:443!cvsroot!moreunit/org.moreunit.plugin/src/org/moreunit/preferences/Preferences.java?revision=1.2)

There are a couple of problems here: 

The first is that we loosing the stack trace of the original exception. I have released a fix for this that will log the original stack trace. 

The second is the failure of the Java 1.6 URI class on the Mac to parse a URI string that is valid according to the spec as documented in the Java 1.4 spec (i.e. we provide an authority String and do not expect the URI to parse out the port but somehow the Java 1.6 USI parser is digging into our authority String). I don't know if this is due to an ambiguity in the spec or a bug in Java 1.6. I'll need to get a hold of a Java 1.6 VM to try it out.

The third is that we are using the URI from the CVS history view. We should be able to simplify this code to access the revision directly. I'll change the code once I figure out why the error is happening.
I have removed the use of reserved characters from the UR authority (even though the spec says its OK) and changes the History view to use a simpler check.
*** Bug 170495 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 173177 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
